resources.string: Keep incoming flashlight centered in the camera preview
Permissions not granted by the user.
Camera permission is required to use the auto decoding feature.
Camera permission is required to use the flashlight.
Tap & hold the icon to transmit manually
Flash is not available on this phone
Grant camera permission in app settings. This is an open source software, we really don\'t use any of your existing photos/videos.
Detailed information about morse code can be found here - \nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morse_code
Play Store app is not installed.
Some problem occurred while trying to show camera preview.
Perceptibility (Keep low when source is far away, high when close)
Press & hold when mocked flashlight is on
Size of analyzed square(Keep small when source is far away, big when close)

Perceptibility means how easily it can be identified that incoming flash is on. Low values mean there is very little contrast between flash on and off states, so luminosity doesn\'t increase much. High means the luminosity difference between the on and off state will be high.

Only a small portion that fits between the red rectangle of the camera preview is used to analyze whether the flash is on or off. If you increase the size of the rectangle, the surroundings of the flashlight have more effect on the calculations.
Incoming timings notes for how long flash was on or off depending on how long the Press & Hold button was held or released.
RESET button clears noted timings. In case you want to start again.
This shows decoded message based on the noted timings. Use the DECODE button to decode messages.
Signal can be useful when you want to notify someone that you\'ll be starting the transmission soon. It is a short message transmitted at a very high speed.

When you start, it takes 3 seconds to analyze the average low luminosity, after 3 seconds you can start receiving the message. It may give wrong results if you start receiving messages before the average low luminosity is calculated.
SOS button sends SOS morse code message.

I started this app as a fun project to learn Android development while doing something interesting. I hope it can be useful for someone who wants to learn encoding and decoding morse code. This is free to use the app without ads.\nThis is an open-source project and code is available on Github. The same code is also stored in The GitHub Arctic Code Vault for hundreds of years :D
Press and hold this button when you see the incoming flashlight as on and release it when it\'s off.
Use DECODE button to decode incoming morse encoded messages.
This shows decoded message based on the noted timings. Use DECODE button to decode messages.
Reset button clears noted timings. In case you want to start again.
Incoming timings notes for how long flash was on or off depending on how long the Press & Hold button was held or released.
Image shows the current status of the flash. It reacts to the PRESS & HOLD button.
Use START button to start transmitting your message. The same button can be used to stop the transmission.
Enter the message that you want to transmit via flashlight.
Morse code of the currently entered message. It appears when you start transmitting the message.
Currently transmitting info shows which character is in transmission with its morse code.
Image shows the current status of the flash. Also, you can tap and hold to manually transmit any morse code.
Use transmission speed to control how fast the flashlight is blinked.
